title: Quiz 10: Comprehensive Review (Unit 7)
description: A final review covering all sections of the Home-Based Care unit.

questions.question: Which phase of HIV/AIDS is characterized by being asymptomatic but having antibodies detectable by laboratory tests?
questions.explanation: Phase 2 is the detection stage where the patient is HIV positive (seroconversion) but may not show signs/symptoms.

questions.question: Match the HBC concept to its definition:

pairs.right: Process of incorporating community for ownership
Organisations working together to strengthen capacities
Two-way process of linking patients between services

questions.explanation: Review of key definitions from different sections.
questions.hint: Match the term to the key action.

questions.question: Which of the following are MAJOR signs of AIDS in children? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Major signs in children are Weight loss/slow growth, Chronic Diarrhoea, and Fever. Thrush and recurrent infections are minor signs.

questions.question: Order the hierarchy of needs in HBC patient care:
questions.explanation: Care must first address physical survival, then safety, then social, then spiritual needs (Maslow's adaptation).

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ technique involves placing a sharp instrument in a container or kidney dish for a colleague to pick up, rather than passing it hand-to-hand.
questions.explanation: The hands-free technique prevents needle-stick injuries during instrument transfer.
questions.hint: A safety technique for passing sharps.

questions.question: Which of the following are 'Protective Foods'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Protective foods provide vitamins/minerals (fruits and vegetables). Meat is Body Building; Maize is Energy Giving.

questions.question: A patient with HIV/AIDS should stop breastfeeding her child immediately if the child develops diarrhoea.
questions.explanation: The text states: 'If the patient is a child who is breastfeeding, continue to breastfeed the child to avoid malnutrition.'

questions.question: What is the recommended concentration ratio of Jik (chlorine) to water for soaking soiled items?
questions.explanation: The text specifies soaking soiled items in Jik 1:6 concentration for ten minutes.
questions.hint: One part Jik to six parts water.

questions.question: Which level of cancer prevention involves screening (e.g., Pap smears)?
questions.explanation: Secondary prevention involves early identification/screening before signs/symptoms develop.

questions.question: What is the main role of the 'Community' as a resource in HBC?

options.text: Providing social, spiritual, and material support

questions.explanation: The community provides the support network (social, spiritual, material) essential for HBC.
